required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: China Registration Study in Patients With Skin Infections
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Multicentre, Randomised, Investigator-blinded, Parallel-groupStudy of the Safety and Efficacy of Intravenous Daptomycin (Cubicin®)Compared With That of Comparator (Vancomycin or Vancomycin Followed by Semi-synthetic Penicillin-cloxacillin) in the Treatment of Chinese Subjects With cSSSI

brief_summary.textblock: The objectives of this study is to evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Intravenous Daptomycin (Cubicin®)Compared with that of Comparator (Vancomycin or Vancomycin Followed by Semi-synthetic Penicillin-cloxacillin) in the Treatment of Chinese Subjects with Complicated Bacterial Skin and Skin Structure Infection due to Gram-Positive Pathogens.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Erythrocyte Volume Fraction(Percentage of Erythrocyte Volume in Total Volume of Blood)
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to TOC(test of cure), for up to 4 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Erythrocyte volume fraction means under certain conditions, after centrifugation pressing, the percentage of erythrocyte volume in the total volume of blood

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to TOC(test of cure), for up to 4 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Serum Total Creatine Phosphokinase (CPK)
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to TOC(test of cure), for up to 4 weeks
baseline to TOC(test of cure), for up to 4 weeks
baseline to TOC(test of cure), for up to 4 weeks
primary_outcome.description: percentage of patients who were primarily tested as normal ECG at baseline and changed into abnormal ECG at TOC visit in all the patients with normal ECG at baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Blinded Investigator's Assessement of Clinical Response at TOC(Test of Cure)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and TOC, for up to 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of patients who were cured or clinically improved in the clinical evaluable (CE) population of each arm at TOC visit was analyzed. CE population includes all the patients with no significant deviation from study protocol in full analysis set population, and meetting the following specific criteria: 1.receiving randomly dispensed study treatment at appropriate time(with a compliance of at least 80% or 4 days [3 days for patients evaluated as treatment failure]). 2.without the administration of potentially confounding non-investigational antibiotics (using one potentially effective non-investigational antibiotic for the treatment of primary infection due to other reasons than lack of efficacy from Day 1 to TOC [for systemicadministration of non-glycopeptides, >1 calendar day]). 3.meeting the study inclusion/exclusion criteria 4.necessary clinical evaluation performed (evaluation for effectiveness at TOC visit, except for the condition confirmed as clinically ineffective)

secondary_outcome.measure: Blinded Investigator's Assessement of Clinical Response at EOT(End of Therapy)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and EOT(end of therapy), for up to 2 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of patients who were cured or clinically improved in the clinical evaluable (CE) population at EOT visit was analyzed. CE population includes all the patients with no significant deviation from study protocol in full analysis set population, and meetting the following specific criteria: 1.receiving randomly dispensed study treatment at appropriate time(with a compliance of at least 80% or 4 days [3 days for patients evaluated as treatment failure]). 2.without the administration of potentially confounding non-investigational antibiotics (using one potentially effective non-investigational antibiotic for the treatment of primary infection due to other reasons than lack of efficacy from Day 1 to TOC [for systemicadministration of non-glycopeptides, >1 calendar day]). 3.meeting the study inclusion/exclusion criteria 4.necessary clinical evaluation performed (evaluation for effectiveness at TOC visit, except for the condition confirmed as clinically ineffective)

secondary_outcome.measure: Microbiological Response at TOC(Test of Cure)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and TOC, for up to 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The microbiological response rate (removal or presumed removal) in ME(microbiological evaluable) population of daptomycin group and comparator group at TOC visit was analyzed. ME population includes all the patients with Gram-positive pathogenic bacteria isolated at baseline in CE population. Microbiological response rate means the percentage of strains which were removed or presumably removed at TOC visit in all the strains isolated from ME population at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Microbiological Response at EOT(End of Therapy)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and EOT, for up to 2 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The microbiological response rate (removal or presumed removal) in ME(microbiological evaluable) population of daptomycin group and comparator group at EOT visit was analyzed. ME population includes all the patients with Gram-positive pathogenic bacteria isolated at baseline in CE population. Microbiological response rate means the percentage of strains which were removed or presumably removed at EOT visit in all the strains isolated from ME population at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Per-pathogen(Methicillin Resistant Staphylococcus Aureus) Clinical Response at TOC(Test of Cure)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and TOC, for up to 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: This is the comparison of clinical efficacy by methicillin resistant staphylococcus aureus(MRSA) between the two groups. As the analysis was performed by specific pathogen in ME population and clinical efficacy was compared meanwhile, the clinical evaluation was based on the number of cases under the category of specific pathogen rather than the number of strains. Percentage of patients who were cured or improved at TOC visit in the patients who were identified with MRSA infection at baseline of both groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Per-pathogen(Methicillin Sensitive Staphylococcus Aureus) Clinical Response at TOC
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and TOC(test of cure), for up to 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: This is the comparison of clinical efficacy by methicillin sensitive staphylococcus aureus(MSSA) between the two groups. As the analysis was performed by specific pathogen in ME population and clinical efficacy was compared meanwhile, the clinical evaluation was based on the number of cases under the category of specific pathogen rather than the number of strains. Percentage of patients who were cured or improved at TOC visit in the patients who were identified with MSSA infection at baseline of both groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Per-pathogen(Staphylococcus Aureus) Microbiological Response at TOC
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and TOC(test of cure), for up to 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: This is the comparison of clinical efficacy by staphylococcus aureus between the two groups. As the analysis was performed by specific pathogen in ME population and clinical efficacy was compared meanwhile, the clinical evaluation was based on the number of cases under the category of specific pathogen rather than the number of strains. Percentage of patients who were cured or improved at TOC visit in the patients who were identified with staphylococcus aureus infection at baseline of both groups.

arm_group.description: Vancomycin or Vancomycin Followed by Semi-synthetic Penicillin-Cloxacillin

intervention.description: Vancomycin - 1g per 12 hrs, for 7-14 days Or switch to Vancomycin Followed by Semi-synthetic Penicillin-Cloxacillin: - 1 g every 6 hours or 2 g every 8 hours

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Provision of inform consent
- A diagnosis of of complicated skin and skin structure infection known or suspected to be due to Gram-positive bacteria
- Diagnosis of bacterial skin and skin structure infection in the presence of some complicating factor, including infections involving deeper soft tissue or requiring surgical intervention, a pre-existing lesion or underlying condition affect healing
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects known to have any bloodstream infection (including bloodstream infection caused by S. aureus). Subjects whose baseline blood cultures are positive for any clinically pathogenic organism ( including S. aureus ) should be discontinued from study
- Minor or superficial skin infections, Infected "decubitus"ulcer, Perirectal abscess, Hidradenitis suppurativa, Myositis, Multiple infected ulcers at distant sites, Infected burn wounds of a large area,
- Conditions requiring surgery that in and of itself would cure the infection or remove the infected site (eg, amputation)
- Conditions requiring emergent surgical intervention at the site of infection (eg, progressive necrotizing infections)

overall_official.affiliation: Antibiotics Institute, Huashan Hospital Affilicated to Fudan University

clinical_study.keyword: Complicated Bacterial Skin and Skin Structure Infection due to Gram-positive Pathogens

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Overall, 265 patients were randomised (daptomycin: 131 patients, comparator: 134 patients), with 264 patients receiving study treatment

group.title: Vancomycin, or Vancomycin Switch to Cloxacillin
group.description: vancomycin 1g per 12 hours, for 7-14 days; or switch to cloxacillin: 1 g every 6 hours or 2 g every 8 hours

baseline.population: One patient was randomized but did not receive any study drug, so the patient was not included in FAS(full analysis set) population analysis.

group.title: Vancomycin, or Vancomycin Switch to Cloxacillin
group.description: vancomycin 1g per 12 hours, for 7-14 days; or switch to cloxacillin: 1 g every 6 hours or 2 g every 8 hours

outcome.description: Erythrocyte volume fraction means under certain conditions, after centrifugation pressing, the percentage of erythrocyte volume in the total volume of blood
outcome.time_frame: baseline to TOC(test of cure), for up to 4 weeks
outcome.population: Only patients who had measurements in both baseline and TOC visit were included for the analysis. Change=TOC visit-baseline

group.description: vancomycin 1g per 12 hours, for 7-14 days; or switch to cloxacillin: 1 g every 6 hours or 2 g every 8 hours

outcome.population: Only patients who had measurements in both baseline and TOC visit were included for the analysis. Change=TOC visit-baseline

outcome.title: Change in Urine pH
outcome.time_frame: baseline to TOC(test of cure), for up to 4 weeks
outcome.population: Only patients who had measurements were included in the summary of a specific parameter at a specific time point. Change = TOC visit - baseline

outcome.title: Shift in ECG
outcome.description: percentage of patients who were primarily tested as normal ECG at baseline and changed into abnormal ECG at TOC visit in all the patients with normal ECG at baseline
outcome.time_frame: baseline to TOC(test of cure), for up to 4 weeks
outcome.population: Only patients who had both measurements at baseline and TOC visit and those who got normal ECG resluts at baseline were included in the summary. Change=TOC visit-baseline

group.title: Vancomycin, or Vancomycin Switch to Cloxacillin
group.description: vancomycin 1g per 12 hrs, for 7-14 days; or switch to cloxacillin: 1 g every 6 hours or 2 g every 8 hours

measure.description: percentage of patients who were primarily tested as normal ECG at baseline and changed into abnormal ECG at TOC visit in all the patients with normal ECG at baseline
measure.population: Only patients who had both measurements at baseline and TOC visit and those who got normal ECG resluts at baseline were included in the summary. Change=TOC visit-baseline

outcome.title: Blinded Investigator's Assessement of Clinical Response at TOC(Test of Cure)
outcome.description: The percentage of patients who were cured or clinically improved in the clinical evaluable (CE) population of each arm at TOC visit was analyzed. CE population includes all the patients with no significant deviation from study protocol in full analysis set population, and meetting the following specific criteria: 1.receiving randomly dispensed study treatment at appropriate time(with a compliance of at least 80% or 4 days [3 days for patients evaluated as treatment failure]). 2.without the administration of potentially confounding non-investigational antibiotics (using one potentially effective non-investigational antibiotic for the treatment of primary infection due to other reasons than lack of efficacy from Day 1 to TOC [for systemicadministration of non-glycopeptides, >1 calendar day]). 3.meeting the study inclusion/exclusion criteria 4.necessary clinical evaluation performed (evaluation for effectiveness at TOC visit, except for the condition confirmed as clinically ineffective)
outcome.time_frame: baseline and TOC, for up to 4 weeks
outcome.population: There were 107 patients in daptomycin arm and 101 patients in comparator arm meeting the criteria of CE population and completed TOC visit.

group.title: Vancomycin, or Vancomycin Switch to Cloxacillin
group.description: vancomycin 1g per 12 hours, for 7-14 days; or switch to cloxacillin: 1 g every 6 hours or 2 g every 8 hours

measure.title: Blinded Investigator's Assessement of Clinical Response at TOC(Test of Cure)
measure.description: The percentage of patients who were cured or clinically improved in the clinical evaluable (CE) population of each arm at TOC visit was analyzed. CE population includes all the patients with no significant deviation from study protocol in full analysis set population, and meetting the following specific criteria: 1.receiving randomly dispensed study treatment at appropriate time(with a compliance of at least 80% or 4 days [3 days for patients evaluated as treatment failure]). 2.without the administration of potentially confounding non-investigational antibiotics (using one potentially effective non-investigational antibiotic for the treatment of primary infection due to other reasons than lack of efficacy from Day 1 to TOC [for systemicadministration of non-glycopeptides, >1 calendar day]). 3.meeting the study inclusion/exclusion criteria 4.necessary clinical evaluation performed (evaluation for effectiveness at TOC visit, except for the condition confirmed as clinically ineffective)
measure.population: There were 107 patients in daptomycin arm and 101 patients in comparator arm meeting the criteria of CE population and completed TOC visit.

outcome.title: Blinded Investigator's Assessement of Clinical Response at EOT(End of Therapy)
outcome.description: The percentage of patients who were cured or clinically improved in the clinical evaluable (CE) population at EOT visit was analyzed. CE population includes all the patients with no significant deviation from study protocol in full analysis set population, and meetting the following specific criteria: 1.receiving randomly dispensed study treatment at appropriate time(with a compliance of at least 80% or 4 days [3 days for patients evaluated as treatment failure]). 2.without the administration of potentially confounding non-investigational antibiotics (using one potentially effective non-investigational antibiotic for the treatment of primary infection due to other reasons than lack of efficacy from Day 1 to TOC [for systemicadministration of non-glycopeptides, >1 calendar day]). 3.meeting the study inclusion/exclusion criteria 4.necessary clinical evaluation performed (evaluation for effectiveness at TOC visit, except for the condition confirmed as clinically ineffective)
outcome.time_frame: baseline and EOT(end of therapy), for up to 2 weeks
outcome.population: There were 110 patients in daptomycin arm and 103 patients in comparator arm who both completed EOT visit and met the criteria of CE population

group.title: Vancomycin, or Vancomycin Switch to Cloxacillin
group.description: vancomycin 1g per 12 hrs, for 7-14 days; or switch to cloxacillin: 1 g every 6 hours or 2 g every 8 hours

measure.title: Blinded Investigator's Assessement of Clinical Response at EOT(End of Therapy)
measure.description: The percentage of patients who were cured or clinically improved in the clinical evaluable (CE) population at EOT visit was analyzed. CE population includes all the patients with no significant deviation from study protocol in full analysis set population, and meetting the following specific criteria: 1.receiving randomly dispensed study treatment at appropriate time(with a compliance of at least 80% or 4 days [3 days for patients evaluated as treatment failure]). 2.without the administration of potentially confounding non-investigational antibiotics (using one potentially effective non-investigational antibiotic for the treatment of primary infection due to other reasons than lack of efficacy from Day 1 to TOC [for systemicadministration of non-glycopeptides, >1 calendar day]). 3.meeting the study inclusion/exclusion criteria 4.necessary clinical evaluation performed (evaluation for effectiveness at TOC visit, except for the condition confirmed as clinically ineffective)
measure.population: There were 110 patients in daptomycin arm and 103 patients in comparator arm who both completed EOT visit and met the criteria of CE population

outcome.title: Microbiological Response at TOC(Test of Cure)
outcome.description: The microbiological response rate (removal or presumed removal) in ME(microbiological evaluable) population of daptomycin group and comparator group at TOC visit was analyzed. ME population includes all the patients with Gram-positive pathogenic bacteria isolated at baseline in CE population. Microbiological response rate means the percentage of strains which were removed or presumably removed at TOC visit in all the strains isolated from ME population at baseline.
outcome.time_frame: baseline and TOC, for up to 4 weeks
outcome.population: ME population includes all the patients with Gram-positive pathogenic bacteria isolated at baseline in CE population. There were 83 strains isolated from ME population of daptomycin arm(78 patients) and 86 strains from ME population in comparator arm(79 patients).

group.title: Vancomycin, or Vancomycin Switch to Cloxacillin
group.description: vancomycin 1g per 12 hours, for 7-14 days; or switch to cloxacillin: 1 g every 6 hours or 2 g every 8 hours

measure.title: Microbiological Response at TOC(Test of Cure)
measure.description: The microbiological response rate (removal or presumed removal) in ME(microbiological evaluable) population of daptomycin group and comparator group at TOC visit was analyzed. ME population includes all the patients with Gram-positive pathogenic bacteria isolated at baseline in CE population. Microbiological response rate means the percentage of strains which were removed or presumably removed at TOC visit in all the strains isolated from ME population at baseline.
measure.population: ME population includes all the patients with Gram-positive pathogenic bacteria isolated at baseline in CE population. There were 83 strains isolated from ME population of daptomycin arm(78 patients) and 86 strains from ME population in comparator arm(79 patients).

outcome.title: Microbiological Response at EOT(End of Therapy)
outcome.description: The microbiological response rate (removal or presumed removal) in ME(microbiological evaluable) population of daptomycin group and comparator group at EOT visit was analyzed. ME population includes all the patients with Gram-positive pathogenic bacteria isolated at baseline in CE population. Microbiological response rate means the percentage of strains which were removed or presumably removed at EOT visit in all the strains isolated from ME population at baseline.
outcome.time_frame: baseline and EOT, for up to 2 weeks
outcome.population: ME population includes all the patients with Gram-positive pathogenic bacteria isolated at baseline in CE population. There were 86 strains isolated from 81 patients in daptomycin arm and 88 strains from 81 patients in comparator arm who met the criteria of ME population at EOT visit.

group.title: Vancomycin, or Vancomycin Switch to Cloxacillin
group.description: vancomycin 1g per 12 hours, for 7-14 days; or switch to cloxacillin: 1 g every 6 hours or 2 g every 8 hours

measure.title: Microbiological Response at EOT(End of Therapy)
measure.description: The microbiological response rate (removal or presumed removal) in ME(microbiological evaluable) population of daptomycin group and comparator group at EOT visit was analyzed. ME population includes all the patients with Gram-positive pathogenic bacteria isolated at baseline in CE population. Microbiological response rate means the percentage of strains which were removed or presumably removed at EOT visit in all the strains isolated from ME population at baseline.
measure.population: ME population includes all the patients with Gram-positive pathogenic bacteria isolated at baseline in CE population. There were 86 strains isolated from 81 patients in daptomycin arm and 88 strains from 81 patients in comparator arm who met the criteria of ME population at EOT visit.

outcome.title: Per-pathogen(Methicillin Resistant Staphylococcus Aureus) Clinical Response at TOC(Test of Cure)
outcome.description: This is the comparison of clinical efficacy by methicillin resistant staphylococcus aureus(MRSA) between the two groups. As the analysis was performed by specific pathogen in ME population and clinical efficacy was compared meanwhile, the clinical evaluation was based on the number of cases under the category of specific pathogen rather than the number of strains. Percentage of patients who were cured or improved at TOC visit in the patients who were identified with MRSA infection at baseline of both groups.
outcome.time_frame: baseline and TOC, for up to 4 weeks
outcome.population: There were 14 patients indentified MRSA infection in daptomycin group and 10 patients indentified with MRSA in comparator group.

group.title: Vancomycin, or Vancomycin Switch to Cloxacillin
group.description: vancomycin 1g per 12 hours, for 7-14 days; or switch to cloxacillin: 1 g every 6 hours or 2 g every 8 hours

measure.title: Per-pathogen(Methicillin Resistant Staphylococcus Aureus) Clinical Response at TOC(Test of Cure)
measure.description: This is the comparison of clinical efficacy by methicillin resistant staphylococcus aureus(MRSA) between the two groups. As the analysis was performed by specific pathogen in ME population and clinical efficacy was compared meanwhile, the clinical evaluation was based on the number of cases under the category of specific pathogen rather than the number of strains. Percentage of patients who were cured or improved at TOC visit in the patients who were identified with MRSA infection at baseline of both groups.
measure.population: There were 14 patients indentified MRSA infection in daptomycin group and 10 patients indentified with MRSA in comparator group.

outcome.title: Per-pathogen(Methicillin Sensitive Staphylococcus Aureus) Clinical Response at TOC
outcome.description: This is the comparison of clinical efficacy by methicillin sensitive staphylococcus aureus(MSSA) between the two groups. As the analysis was performed by specific pathogen in ME population and clinical efficacy was compared meanwhile, the clinical evaluation was based on the number of cases under the category of specific pathogen rather than the number of strains. Percentage of patients who were cured or improved at TOC visit in the patients who were identified with MSSA infection at baseline of both groups.
outcome.time_frame: baseline and TOC(test of cure), for up to 4 weeks
outcome.population: There were 33 patients indentified MSSA infection in daptomycin group and 37 patients indentified with MSSA in comparator group.

group.title: Vancomycin, or Vancomycin Switch to Cloxacillin
group.description: vancomycin 1g per 12 hours, for 7-14 days; or switch to cloxacillin: 1 g every 6 hours or 2 g every 8 hours

measure.title: Per-pathogen(Methicillin Sensitive Staphylococcus Aureus) Clinical Response at TOC
measure.description: This is the comparison of clinical efficacy by methicillin sensitive staphylococcus aureus(MSSA) between the two groups. As the analysis was performed by specific pathogen in ME population and clinical efficacy was compared meanwhile, the clinical evaluation was based on the number of cases under the category of specific pathogen rather than the number of strains. Percentage of patients who were cured or improved at TOC visit in the patients who were identified with MSSA infection at baseline of both groups.
measure.population: There were 33 patients indentified MSSA infection in daptomycin group and 37 patients indentified with MSSA in comparator group.

outcome.title: Per-pathogen(Staphylococcus Aureus) Microbiological Response at TOC
outcome.description: This is the comparison of clinical efficacy by staphylococcus aureus between the two groups. As the analysis was performed by specific pathogen in ME population and clinical efficacy was compared meanwhile, the clinical evaluation was based on the number of cases under the category of specific pathogen rather than the number of strains. Percentage of patients who were cured or improved at TOC visit in the patients who were identified with staphylococcus aureus infection at baseline of both groups.
outcome.time_frame: baseline and TOC(test of cure), for up to 4 weeks
outcome.population: There were 48 patients indentified staphylococcus aureus infection both in daptomycin group and in comparator group.

group.title: Vancomycin, or Vancomycin Switch to Cloxacillin
group.description: vancomycin 1g per 12 hours, for 7-14 days; or switch to cloxacillin: 1 g every 6 hours or 2 g every 8 hours

measure.description: This is the comparison of clinical efficacy by staphylococcus aureus between the two groups. As the analysis was performed by specific pathogen in ME population and clinical efficacy was compared meanwhile, the clinical evaluation was based on the number of cases under the category of specific pathogen rather than the number of strains. Percentage of patients who were cured or improved at TOC visit in the patients who were identified with staphylococcus aureus infection at baseline of both groups.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
